answers.text: environments where they complete their life

qas.question: What is the goal of plant ecology?
What is the study of plants and the environment in which they live?
What do plants do in their environment?

context: <a2_0>Plant ecology<a2_0/> is the science of the functional relationships between plants and their habitats—the <a0_0>environments where they complete their life<a0_0/> cycles. Plant ecologists study the composition of local and regional floras, their biodiversity, genetic diversity and fitness, the adaptation of plants to their environment, and their competitive or mutualistic <a3_0>interactions with other species<a3_0/>. The goals of plant ecology are <a1_0>to understand<a1_0/> the causes of their distribution patterns, productivity, environmental impact, evolution, and responses to environmental change.
